speech.p: My hon. Friend the Member for Morecambe and Lunesdale (Geraldine Smith) and hon. Friend the Member for Finchley and Golders Green (Dr. Vis) have been appointed as full members for the United Kingdom delegation to the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe and the Assembly of Western European Union.

My hon. Friend the Member for Erith and Thamesmead (John Austin) and my hon. Friend the Member for Portsmouth, North (Syd Rapson BEM) have been appointed substitute representatives of the United Kingdom delegation to the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe and the Assembly of Western European Union.

speech.speakeroffice: The Secretary of State for Transport
speech.p: During my opening speech on Second Reading of the Road Safety Bill on Tuesday 11 January 2005, Official Report, at column 223, I said,
"Indeed, one in five accidents involve a driver who has passed their test in the precedingyear".
What I should have said was that as many as one in five new drivers has an accident within the first year of passing the driving test.
